title: If no webapps deployed, accessing a URL returns 200 OK with no content instead of 404
description: Ali Tokmen from http://ali.tokmen.com/ reported a bug where accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps returns an HTTP code 200 OK with no content instead of an HTTP error 404.
OB: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, it returns an HTTP code 200 OK with no content.
EB: When accessing a URL on a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed, it should return an HTTP error 404.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Download http://mirror.veriportal.com/apache/tomcat/tomcat7/v7.0.0beta/bin/apachetomcat7.0.0.zip.
2. Start a Tomcat 7 instance with no webapps deployed.
3. Access a URL on the Tomcat 7 instance.

Expected result: An HTTP error 404 should be returned.

Actual result: An HTTP code 200 OK with no content is returned.
